qas.question: When did an angel supposedly speak to Bathurst?
What political position did Samuel Johnson say would soon poison America?
In Samuel Johnson's writing, who appeared to a Whig?

plausible_answers.text: the future greatness of England and also of America

qas.question: What mythical creature prophesied to Burke?
Who was impressed by Bathurst's prophesy?
What political party did Johnson claim the angel represented?

context: Among the reasons this speech was so greatly admired was its passage on Lord Bathurst (<a3_0>1684<a3_0/>–<a0_0><b6_0>1775<b6_0/><a0_0/>); Burke describes <b7_0>an angel<b7_0/> in <a1_0>1704<a1_0/> prophesying to Bathurst <b5_0>the future greatness of England and also of America<b5_0/>: "Young man, There is America – which at this day serves little more than to amuse you with stories of savage men, and uncouth manners; yet shall, before you taste of death, shew itself equal to the whole of that commerce which now attracts the envy of the world". <b8_0>Samuel Johnson<b8_0/> was so irritated at hearing it continually praised, that he made a parody of it, where <a4_0>the devil<a4_0/> appears to a young Whig and predicts that in short time, <a2_0><b9_0>Whiggism<b9_0/><a2_0/> will poison even the paradise of America!
